intro: Uragoga flavescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered uragoga, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a velvety texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters. Uragoga flavescens is noted for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal practices.
